colophon: Opus elementorum euclidis megarensis in geometriam artem In id quoque Campani perspicacissimi Commentationes finiunt. Erhardus ratdolt Augustensis impressor solertissimus. venetijs impres-sit. Anno salutis. M.cccc.lxxxij. Octauis. Calen. Iun. Lector. Vale.
colophon_EN: The work of Euclid of Megara on the art of geometry, in which also the most perceptive commentaries of Campanus conclude. Erhard Ratdolt of Augsburg, a most skillful printer, printed in Venice. In the year of salvation 1482, on the eighth day before the Calends of June. Reader, farewell.
notes: Vinci marked author as Campano

title_EN:
[Part 1]: These are the works of Boethius: which are contained in this volume.
[Part 2]: Here begins the table on the books of Boethius on the consolation of philosophy according to the order of the alphabet.
colophon:
[Part 1] Uenetijs Impressum Boetij opus per Joannem et Gregorium de gregorijs fratres foelici exitu ad finem vsque perductum accuratissimeque emendatum Anno humane restaurationis. 1492. die.
18. Augusti. Augustino Barbadico Serenissimo Uenetiarum principe Rem pu. tenente.
[Part 2] Diui. Seuerini Boetij de consolatione: necnon de scolarium disciplina mellifluis operibus: cum sancti Thomae super vtroque commentarijs: in hoc eodem volumine. Jmpressis venetijs per Joannem de Forliuio et Gregorium fratres. Anno salutis. M.cccc.lxxxxj. die. xxvj. mensis Martij.
colophon_EN:
[Part 1] The work of Boethius, "Uenetijs Impressum," brought to completion with a happy outcome by the brothers Joannes and Gregorius de Gregorijs, most accurately corrected in the year of human restoration, 1492, on the 18th day of August, under the most serene prince of Venice, Augustinus Barbadicus, holding the public office.

[Part 2] The divine works of Severinus Boethius on consolation, as well as on the discipline of scholars, with the commentaries of Saint Thomas on both, in this same volume. Printed in Venice by Joannes de Forlivio and the brothers Gregorius in the year of salvation, 1491, on the 26th day of the month of March.
notes:
We don't have the title page, and from the wording of the title we do have, I suspect there is no title page… The EiP title is: "[Part 1]: Haec sunt opera Boetii: quae in hoc volumine continentur.
[Part 2]: Incipit tabula super libris Boetij de consolatione philo-sophiae secundum ordinem alphabeti."

title_EN: Georgio Valla Placentino Interpreter. This volume contains the following. Nicephorus' Logic[.] Georgio Valla's booklet on arguments[.] Euclid's fourteenth book of Elements. Hypsicles' interpretation of the same book of Euclid [etc]

[Part 3] Adest finis Diui. Seuerini Boetii de consolatione. necnon de scolarium disciplina mellifluis operibus cum sancti Tome super vtroque commentariis. in hoc eodem volumine. Impressis venetiis per Ioannem de Forliuio et Gregorium fratres Anno salutis. Mcccclxxxxvii die. x. februarii.
colophon_EN:
[Part 1: None.]
[Part 2] In Venice. The work of Boethius was printed by Ioannes and Gregorius de Gregoriis, brothers, brought to a successful conclusion and most accurately corrected in the Year of Human Restoration, 1499, on the 8th day of July, with Augustino Barbadico, the Most Serene Prince of Venice, holding the Republic.
[Part 3] Here ends the divine work of Severinus Boethius on consolation, as well as on the discipline of scholars, with the mellifluous works and the commentaries of Saint Thomas on both, printed in this same volume in Venice by Ioannes de Forlivio and the brothers Gregorius in the Year of Salvation, 1497, on the 10th day of February.

title: Euclidis megarensis philosophi platonicj Mathematicarum disci-plinarum Ianitoris: Habent in hoc volumine quicumque ad mathemat-icam substantiam aspirant: elementorum libros. xiij. cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici. quibus multa quae deerant ex lectione graeca sumpta addita sub nec non plurima subuersa et prepostere: voluta in Campani interpretatione: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt. Quibus etiam nonnulla ab illo venerando. Socratico philosopho mirando iudicio structa habentur adiuncta. Deputatum scilicet Euclidi volumen. xiiij. cum expositione Hypsi. Alex. Itidemque et Phaeno. Specu. et Perspe. cum expositione Theonis. ac mirandus ille liber Datorum cum expositione Pappi Mechanici vna cum Marini dialectici protheoria. Bar. Zamber. Vene. Interprete. Cum grat¬Øƒ±a et Priuilegio per decennium.
title_EN: Euclid of Megara, a Platonic philosopher, the gatekeeper of mathematical disciplines: In this volume, those who aspire to the substance of mathematics will find: thirteen books of the Elements, with the exposition of Theon, a distinguished mathematician. Many things that were missing have been added, taken from the Greek reading, and not a few have been overturned and improperly handled in Campanus's interpretation; they have been arranged, organized, and corrected. To these are also added some things constructed by that venerable Socratic philosopher with admirable judgment. Namely, the fourteenth book attributed to Euclid, with the exposition of Hypsicles of Alexandria. Likewise, Phaenomena, Optics, and Catoptrics with the exposition of Theon, and that marvelous book of Data with the exposition of Pappus the Mechanic, together with the protheoria of Marinus the Dialectician. Bartholomew Zamberti of Venice, Interpreter. With grace and privilege for a decade.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici
TITLE: EUCLID DESCRIPTION: megarensis philosophi platonicj Mathematicarum disci-plinarum Ianitoris
OTHER NAMES: Theonis, Hypsi. Alex., Pappi Mechanici, Marini dialectici

colophon_EN: Impressum in Venice under fortunate auspices, this work is golden and most rare: in the house of Giovanni Tacuino, bookseller, reviewed with the most accurate diligence. In the year of reconciled divinity. 1505. On the eighth day before the Kalends of November. Under the auspices of the most fortunate Republic of Venice. Of Leonardo Loredan: the most wise prince: It is nevertheless decreed by the sanction of the dominion: that no one may print this work in Venice: or dare to sell it printed elsewhere: under penalty as more precisely read in the Privilege.

title: Preclarissimus liber elementorum Euclidis perspicacissimi. in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime
title_EN: The most illustrious book of the elements of the most perceptive Euclid. in the art of Geometry begins most happily
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: perspicacissimi
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime
colophon: Et tantum de quatuor libris elementorum Euclidis cum fa-miliari Campani in eosdem comentario. qui cum in omnibus vniuer-salibus studijs ordinaria institucione preeleguntur sic eciam in hac nos-tra achademia franckfordiana. ab illustrissimis Ioachim principe elec-tore et Alberto germanj marchionibus Brandeburgj nuper erecta. per Mgrm Ambrosium lacher de Merspurg mathematicum ibidemque Colle-giatum accurata diligencia lecti castigati propriisque impensis elaborati sunt atque impressi ut athenarum more studium philosophie a mathe-matico splendore mirifice inceptum efflorescat Anno salutis. vi.
colophon_EN: And so much from the four books of Euclid's Elements with the familiar commentary of Campanus on the same. which, as they are ordinarily preferred in all universal studies, so also in this our Frankfort academy. recently established by the most illustrious Joachim, prince elector, and Albert, margraves of Brandenburg. by Master Ambrosius Lacher of Merspurg, mathematician and fellow there, they have been read with accurate diligence, corrected, and elaborated at their own expense and printed so that, in the manner of Athens, the study of philosophy wonderfully begun may flourish from the mathematical splendor. In the year of salvation. vi.

title:
Euclidis megarensis philosophi acutissimi mathematicorumque omnium sine controuersia principis opera a Campano interprete fidissimo tralata Que cum antea librariorum detestanda culpa mendis fedissimis adeo deformia essent: vt vix Euclidem ipsum agnoscere-mus. Lucas paciolus theologus insignis: altissima Mathematicarum disciplinarum scientia rarissimus iudicio castigatissimo detersit: emen-dauit. Figuras centum et vndetriginta que in alijs codicibus inuerse et deformate erant: ad rectam symmetriam concinnauit: et multas necessarias addidit. Eundem quoque plurimis locis intellectu diicilem commentariolis sane luculentis et eruditiss. aperuit: enarrauit: illustrauit Adhec vt elimatior exiret Scipio vegius mediol. vir vtraque lingua: arte medica: sublimioribusque studijs clarissimus diligentiam: et censuram
suam prestitit.
title_EN: The works of Euclid of Megara, the most acute philosopher and without controversy the prince of all mathematicians, translated by Campanus, the most faithful interpreter. These works, which previously, due to the deplorable fault of scribes, were so deformed by the most foul errors that we could scarcely recognize Euclid himself. Lucas Pacioli, a distinguished theologian, exceedingly rare in the highest knowledge of mathematical disciplines, with the most discerning judgment, cleansed and corrected them. He arranged one hundred and thirty-nine figures, which in other manuscripts were inverted and deformed, into correct symmetry and added many necessary ones. In many places, he also elucidated, explained, and illustrated the same work, which was difficult to understand, with very clear and most learned commentaries. Moreover, so that it might emerge more refined, Scipio Vegius of Milan, a man renowned in both languages, the medical art, and higher studies, provided his diligence and critique.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: Euclidis megarensis philosophi acutissimi mathematicorumque omnium sine controuersia principis opera
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: a Campano interprete fidissimo tralata
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: altissima Mathematicarum disciplinarum scientia rarissimus iudicio castigatissimo detersit: emen-dauit

TITLE: EDITION INFO: Que cum antea librariorum detestanda culpa mendis fedissimis adeo deformia essent: vt vix Euclidem ipsum agnoscere-mus
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Figuras centum et vndetriginta que in alijs codicibus inuerse et deformate erant: ad rectam symmetriam concinnauit: et multas necessarias addidit
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2: Eundem quoque plurimis locis intellectu diicilem commentariolis sane luculentis et eruditiss. aperuit: enarrauit: illustrauit

colophon:
Euclidis megarensis philosophi perspicacissimi elemen-torum opus de duabus quantitatibus discreta scilicet et continua. ac earundem proportionibus et proportionalitatibus: ex optima Campani interpretatione. Magistro Luca paciolo de Burgo Sancti Sepulchri Ordinis Minorum sacre theologie professore. Matematiceque discipline cultore feruentissimo die noctuque chalcographis asistente postillis suis oportunis plerisque in locis additis manu propria accuratissime castigatum finit.
Venetiis impressum per probum Virum Paganinum de Paganinis de Brixia decreto tamen publico vt nullus ibidem totique dominio annorum .xv. curriculo imprimat aut imprimere faciat. et alibi impres-sum sub quouis colore in publicum ducat sub penis in dicto priuilegio contentis Anno redemptionis nostre .M.D.VIIII. Klen .XI. Iunii. Leonardo Lauretano Ve. Re. Pu. Gubernante. Pontificatus Iulii .II. Anno .VI.
imprint: A. Paganius Paganinus Characteribus elegantissimis accu-ratissime imprimebat.
colophon_EN:
The work of the most perceptive philosopher Euclid of Megara on the elements concerning two quantities, namely discrete and continuous, and their proportions and proportionalities: from the best interpretation of Campanus. By Master Luca Pacioli of Borgo San Sepolcro, a professor of sacred theology of the Order of Friars Minor, and a most fervent devotee of the mathematical discipline, assisting the printers day and night, with his own hand most accurately corrected, with his appropriate annotations added in many places.

Printed in Venice by the honorable man Paganinus de Paganinis of Brescia, yet by public decree that no one there or in the entire dominion for the course of fifteen years may print or cause to be printed, and that it may not be brought into public elsewhere under any pretext, under the penalties contained in the said privilege. In the year of our redemption 1509, the eleventh day of June, under the governance of Leonardo Loredan, Doge of the Venetian Republic. In the sixth year of the pontificate of Julius II.
imprint_EN: A. Paganius Paganinus was printing with the most elegant characters very accurately.

title:
Euclidis Megarensis philosophi platonicj Mathematicarum disci-plinarum Ianitoris: Habent in hoc volumine quicumque ad mathemat-
icam substantiam aspirant: elementorum libros. xiij. cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici. quibus multa quae deerant ex lectione graeca sumpta addita sub nec non plurima subuersa et prepostere: voluta in Campani interpretatione: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt. Quibus etiam nonnulla ab illo venerando. Socratico philosopho mirando iudicio structa habentur adiuncta. Deputatum scilicet Euclidi volumen. xiiij. cum expositione Hypsi. Alex. Itidemque et Phaeno. title_EN: Euclidis Megarensis, the Platonic philosopher, the Janitor of Mathematical disciplines: In this volume, those who aspire to the substance of mathematics will find: thirteen books of the Elements, with the exposition of Theon, the distinguished mathematician. Many things that were missing have been added, taken from the Greek reading, and not only many things overturned and preposterously: turned in Campanus' interpretation: they have been ordered, arranged, and corrected. To which also some things constructed by that venerable Socratic philosopher with admirable judgment are attached. Namely, the fourteenth volume assigned to Euclid, with the exposition of Hypsicles of Alexandria. Likewise, Phaenomena, Specularia, and Perspectiva, with the exposition of Theon. And that marvelous book of Data with the exposition of Pappus the Mechanic, together with the protheoria of Marinus the Dialectician. Bartholomew Zamberti of Venice, Interpreter. With grace and privilege for a decade.

CONTENTA. EVCLIDIS Megarensis Geometricorum el-ementorum libri XV. CAMPANI Galli transalpini in eosdem commentariorum libri XV. THEONIS Alexandrini Bartholam√¶o Zamberto Veneto interprete, in tredecim priores, commentariorum libri XIII. HYPSICLIS Alexandrini in duos posteriores, eodem Bartholam√¶o Zamberto Veneto interprete, commentariorum libri
II. VTCVNQVE NOSTER VALVIT LABOR conciliata sunt h√¶c omnia, ad studiosorum non paruam (quam optamus) vtilitatem: id Magnifico D. FRANCISCO Briconneto postulante. Si h√¶c beneuole suscipiantur, & fructum adferant quem cupimus: alia eiusdem authoris opera prodibunt in lucem, successum pr√¶stante deo, & adiutoribus (vbivbi gentium sint) ad bonarum literarum institutionem probe affectis Gallis, Italis, Germanis, Hispanis, Anglis. quibus omnibus prospera imprecamur: & puram pro dignitate veramque cognitionis lucem.
title_EN: CONTENT. EVCLIDIS of Megara's fifteen books of geometric elements. CAMPANUS of Gallia Transalpina's fifteen books of commentary on the same. THEON of Alexandria, interpreted by Bartholomew Zamberto of Venice, thirteen books of commentary on the first thirteen. HYPSICLES of Alexandria, on the last two, interpreted by the same Bartholomew Zamberto of Venice, two books of commentary. HOWEVER OUR LABOR HAS BEEN WORTHWHILE, all these have been compiled for the not insignificant (we hope) benefit of students: at the request of the Magnificent D. FRANCISCO Briconneto. If these are received kindly, and bring the fruit we desire: other works of the same author will come to light, with the success granted by God, and with the help of those (wherever they may be) well-disposed towards the establishment of good letters, whether they be French, Italians, Germans, Spaniards, or English. To all of whom we wish prosperity: and a pure and true light of knowledge worthy of their dignity.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS Megarensis Geometricorum el-ementorum libri XV
OTHER NAMES: CAMPANI Galli transalpini, THEONIS Alexandrini, HYPSICLIS Alexandrini
TITLE: PATRON REF: id Magnifico D. FRANCISCO Briconneto postulante

GERARDVS NOVIOMAGVS
Lectori:

Quid punctum, quid linea, circulus, angulus, orbis
Designet; paucis haec elementa docent.
Sydereos cursus hinc disces; ut venerere
Patrem, qui terras condidit, astra, polos.
title_EN:
ELEMENTARY
GEOMETRY, FROM EUCLID'S
Geometry, extracted by Johannes V≈ìgelin of Heilbronn,
for the benefit of all students of Mathematics.

GERARDUS NOVIOMAGUS
To the Reader:

What a point, what a line, circle, angle, sphere
Signify; these few elements teach.
From here you will learn the courses of the stars; so that you may revere
The Father, who created the earth, stars, and heavens.

EMENtorum Geometricorum. Lib. XV. Cum expositione THEONIS in priores XIII √† Batholom√¶o Veneto latinitate donata, CAMPANI in omnes, & HYPSICLIS Alexandrini in duos postremos. His adiecta sunt Ph√¶nomena, Catoptrica & Optica, deinde Protheoria Marini & Data, Postrem√ªm uero, Opusculum de Leui & Ponderoso, hactenus non uisum, eiusdem autoris.
title_EN: EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, GEOMETRIC ELEMENTS. Book XV. With the exposition of THEON on the first XIII translated into Latin by Bartholomew of Venice, CAMPANUS on all, & HYPSICLES of Alexandria on the last two. Added to these are the Phenomena, Catoptrics & Optics, then the Protheoria of Marinus & Data, and finally, the Treatise on the Light and the Heavy, hitherto unseen, by the same author.

title:
Das erst buch der Geometria.

Ein kurtze unterweisung, was vnd worauff
Geometria gegr√ºndet sey, vnd wie man / nach anweisung der selben / mit dem Circkel vnd Richtscheydt / allerley Lini / Flech / vnd C√∂rper au√üztheylen / vnd in f√ºrgegebener propozition / machen soll. Aus bewerten leren / gemelter freyen kunst / allen liebhabern der selben / zu einem eingang / vnd allen k√ºnstlichen werckleuten zu sonderm nutz vnd vorteyl zusammen gezogen

Durch Wolfgang Schmid Rechen-
meyster zu Bamberg.

Die kunst so im Euclide steet
Gar manchem alzu ser verdeckt
Wirt hie gar leicht und liecht gemacht
Durch dise anleytung / wool betracht.

Getruckt zu N√ºrnberg.
Mit R√∂m. Keysl. und K√∂nig. May.
Privilegio auff VI. Jar.
title_EN:
The First Book of Geometry.

A brief instruction on what and upon what
Geometry is founded, and how one / according to the guidance of the same / with the compass and straightedge / should divide all kinds of lines / surfaces / and bodies / and in a given proposition / should make. Compiled from proven teachings / of the aforementioned liberal art / for all enthusiasts of the same / as an introduction / and for all skilled craftsmen for special use and advantage.

By Wolfgang Schmid, Master of Calculation
in Bamberg.

The art that stands in Euclid
Is far too hidden for many
Here it is made very easy and simple
Through this guidance / well considered.

Printed in Nuremberg.
With Roman Imperial and Royal Majesty's
Privilege for VI years.

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI IN OMNIBVS PHILO-
SOPHIAE PARTIBVS INTER LAtinos & Gr√¶cos autores principis OPERA, qu√¶ extant, omnia, non solum liberalium disciplinarum, sed maiorum facultatum studiosis etiam utilissima. sine quibus Aristoteles in pr√¶cipuis locis intellegi non potest. Quare summi uiri rect√® censebant, uer√® studiosum non esse in cuius bibliotheca hic autor non erat. Porr√≤, infinitis locis non aliquot uoces, sed longas periodos qu√¶ in prioribus √¶ditionibus desiderabantur, emendauimus, adiuti praesidio uetustissimorum manuscriptorum exemplarium, & auxilio doctissimorum uirorum: Inter quos in omni literarum genere summus uir HENRICHVS LORITVS GLAREANVS Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam suo pristino nitori restituit, cui exemplar aureum uenerand√¶que uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MARTIANVS ROTA opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialectic√¶ & Rhetoric√¶ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam certis coniecturis, cum ex alijs, tum ex Bo√´thi monumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
title_EN: THE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, THE FOREMOST AUTHOR IN ALL PARTS OF PHILOSOPHY AMONG LATIN AND GREEK AUTHORS, which are extant, all of them, not only most useful to students of the liberal disciplines, but also to those of the higher faculties. Without which, Aristotle cannot be understood in the principal places. Therefore, the greatest men rightly judged that one was not truly a student in whose library this author was not present. Furthermore, in countless places, we have corrected not just some words, but long periods that were missing in previous editions, aided by the support of the oldest manuscript copies, and the assistance of the most learned men: Among whom, in every kind of literature, the greatest man HENRICHUS LORITUS GLAREANUS restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor, for which an exemplar of golden and venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectic and Rhetoric. And he faithfully described the life of this author, collected with certain conjectures, both from others and from Boethius's own monuments.
OTHER NAMES: Aristoteles, HENRICHVS LORITVS GLAREANVS, MARTIANVS ROTA
TITLE: EDITION INFO: infinitis locis non aliquot uoces, sed longas periodos qu√¶ in prioribus √¶ditionibus desiderabantur, emendauimus

title_EN: The fifteen books of the most renowned mathematician Euclid of Megara on the geometric Elements. With the exposition of Theon on the first thirteen translated into Latin by Bartholomew Zamberto of Venice, Campanus on all, and Hypsicles of Alexandria on the last two. Added to these are the Phenomena, Catoptrics & Optics, then the Protheoria of Marinus, & the Data. Finally, the treatise on the Light and the Heavy, hitherto unseen, by the same author.

title: Die Sechs Erste B√ºcher Euclidis, Vom anfang oder grund der Geometrj. In welchen der rechte grund, nitt allain der Geometrj (versteh alles kunstlichen, gwisen, vnd vortailigen gebrauchs des Zirckels, Linials oder Richtscheittes vnd andrer werckze√ºge, so z√º allerlaj abmessen dienstlich) sonder auch der f√ºrnemsten stuck vnd vortail der Rechenkhunst, furgeschriben vnd dargethon ist. Au√ü Griechischer sprach in die Te√ºtsch gebracht, aigenttlich erkl√§rt, Auch mit verstentlichen Exempeln, gr√ºndlichen Figurn, vnd allerlaj den nutz f√ºraugen stellenden Anh√§ngen geziert, Dermassen vormals in Te√ºtscher sprach nie gesehen worden. Alles z√º lieb vnd gebrauch den Kunstliebenden Te√ºtschen, so sych der Geometrj vnd Rechenkunst anmassen, mit vilf√§ltiger m√ºhe vnd arbait zum trewlichsten erarnet, vnd in Truckh gegeben, Durch Wilhelm Holtzman, genant Xylander, von Augspurg.
title_EN: The Six First Books of Euclid, From the beginning or foundation of Geometry. In which the true foundation, not only of Geometry (understand all artificial, certain, and advantageous use of the compass, ruler or straightedge, and other tools, which are useful for all kinds of measurement) but also of the principal parts and advantages of arithmetic, is prescribed and demonstrated. Translated from the Greek language into German, properly explained, Also adorned with understandable examples, thorough figures, and all kinds of appendices presenting the utility, In a manner never before seen in the German language. All for the love and use of the art-loving Germans, who take up Geometry and arithmetic, earned with much effort and work most faithfully, and given in print, By Wilhelm Holtzman, called Xylander, from Augsburg.

TO THIS IS ADDED A SIXTEENTH BOOK, ON THE COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER, AND ALSO A BEGUN WORK ON THE COMPLETION OF REGULAR COMPOSITE SOLIDS. BY THE AUTHOR Francis Flussate Candalla. TO Charles IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRANKS.

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI, PHILOSOPHORVM
ET THEOLOGORVM PRINCIPIS OPERA omnia, quorum alia ant√® impressa, nunc denu√≤ per doctos uiros recognita: alia, qu√¶ hactenus latuerunt, nunc prim√πm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt. In quibus pr√¶ter uniuers√¶ philosophi√¶ exactissimam doctrinam, pluri-morum in diuinis mysteriorum, & diiciliorum locorum in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Gr√¶cis & Latinis autoribus luculentissim√¶ expli-cationes reperiuntur. PRAETEREA IAM ACCESSERVNT, Ioannis Murmelij in v. Lib. De Consolatione Philosophi√¶ commentaria. Et in eosdem Rodolphi Agricol√¶ Enarrationes. Item, Gilberti Porret√¶, Episcopi Pictauiensis in IIII. Lib. de Trinitate commentarij, ant√® nun-quam √¶diti.  Pr√¶ter reliquos doctiss. uiros, HENRICVS LORITVS
GLAREANVS, Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam, suo pristino nitori restituit: Cui exemplar aureum uenerand√¶que uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MAR-TIANVS ROTA, opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialectic√¶ & Rhetoric√¶ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam, c√πm ex alijs, tum ex Bo√´thi munumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
title_EN:
THE COMPLETE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, PRINCE OF PHILOSOPHERS
AND THEOLOGIANS, some of which were previously printed, now newly reviewed by learned men: others, which have remained hidden until now, are now for the first time published in a most corrected form. In which, besides the most exact doctrine of universal philosophy, the most splendid explanations of many divine mysteries, and the more difficult passages in Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek and Latin authors are found. FURTHERMORE, THERE HAVE NOW BEEN ADDED, the commentaries of Johannes Murmelius on the five books of The Consolation of Philosophy. And the Explanations on the same by Rodolphus Agricola. Also, the commentaries of Gilbert Porreta, Bishop of Poitiers, on the four books on the Trinity, never before published. Besides other most learned men, HENRICUS LORITUS
GLAREANUS, has restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor: For whom a golden example of venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA, has illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectics and Rhetoric. And he has faithfully described the life of this author, collected from both other sources and Boethius's own monuments.
EXPLICITLY STATED: TRANSLATED FROM: in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Gr√¶cis & Latinis autoribus

title:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV. AD GERMANAM GEOmetri√¶ intel-
ligentiam √® diuersis lapsibus temporis iniuria contractis restituta, Adimpletis pr√¶ter maiorum spem, qu√¶ hactenus deerant, solidorum regularium conferentiis ac inscriptionibus. Accessit decimussextus liber, de solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus. Nouissim√® collati sunt decimusseptimus & decimusoctauus, priori edi-tione quodammodo polliciti, de componendorum, inscribendorum, & conferendorum compositorum solidorum inuentis, ordine & numero absoluti. AVTHORE D. Francisco Flussate Candalla. AD CAROLVM
IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM REGEM.
title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED BY THE INJURY OF TIME, WITH ADDITIONS BEYOND THE EXPECTATION OF THE ANCIENTS, WHICH HAVE HITHERTO BEEN LACKING, OF THE DISCUSSIONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS. A SIXTEENTH BOOK HAS BEEN ADDED, ON THE COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER. RECENTLY, THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH HAVE BEEN ADDED, IN SOME WAY PROMISED IN THE PREVIOUS EDITION, ON THE INVENTIONS, ORDER, AND NUMBER OF COMPOSITE SOLIDS TO BE COMPOSED, INSCRIBED, AND COMPARED. BY THE AUTHOR D. Francisco Flussate Candalla. TO CHARLES IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRANKS.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: AD GERMANAM
TITLE: PATRON REF:
AD CAROLVM
IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM REGEM.

title:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV. AD GERMANAM GEOMETRIAE INTELLIGENTIAM, E DIVERSIS LAPSIBVS TEMPORIS INIVRIA CONTRACTIS RESTITUTA, ADIMPLETIS PRAETER
MAIORVM SPEM, QUAE HACTEnus deerant, solidorum regu-larium conferentijs ac inscriptionibus. Accessit decimussextus liber, ac solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus. Nouissim√® collati sunt decimusseptimus & decimusoctauus, priori editioni quodammodo polliciti, de componendorum, inscribendo-rum, & conferendorum compositorum solidorum inuentis, ordine & numero absoluti. AVTHORE D. FRANCISCO FLVSSATE CAN-DALLA. AD CAROLVM IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM
REGEM.
title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY, FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED THROUGH THE INJURY OF TIME, FULFILLED BEYOND THE HOPE OF THE ANCIENTS, WITH THE ADDITION OF THE COMPARISONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS WHICH WERE HITHERTO LACKING. THE SIXTEENTH BOOK HAS BEEN ADDED, WITH COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER. MOST RECENTLY, THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH HAVE BEEN ADDED, IN SOME WAY PROMISED IN THE PRIOR EDITION, COMPLETED IN ORDER AND NUMBER, ON THE INVENTIONS OF COMPOSING, INSCRIBING, AND COMPARING COMPOSITE SOLIDS. BY THE AUTHOR D. FRANCISCO FLUSSATE CANDALLA. TO CHARLES IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRENCH.

Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ‚Äôtmaken, veranderen, ‚Äôtsamen-voughen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen. Overgeset, verclaert, ende uytgeleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe, lief
hebbers der selver vryer Conste. Door IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer. Van nieus oversien, ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de bygevouchde nutticheden mette spetien in Geometrische figueren breeder verclaert ende vermeerdert deur den selven Autheur.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and interpreted, for the advancement and practice, of all curious, enthusiasts of the same liberal Art. By IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, Land Surveyor and Wine Gauger of the city of Leiden. Newly reviewed, and improved: Together with the added utilities with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded by the same Author.

title:
NOVA REPERTA
GEOMETRICA
IOHANNIS ALFONSI
MOLINENSIS CANI,

In quibus subtiliores Geometricae quaestiones de
Duplicatione Cubi, Quadratura circuli, Rectitudine angulorum, Aequalitate linearum curvarum cum recta discutientur: Demonstrationibus firmissimis fulciuntur: indeque aurea corollaria Geometricarum subtilitatum deducuntur: Euclidea Elementa nonnulla corriguntur, nonnulla ut falsa reijciuntur.

Hispanice edita, jam vero latinitate donata
a
NICOLAO IANSONIO
Arnh. Geldro.
title_EN:
NEW DISCOVERIES
GEOMETRICA
OF JOHANNES ALFONSI
OF MOLINA,

In which the more subtle questions of Geometry concerning
the Duplication of the Cube, the Quadrature of the Circle, the Straightness of Angles, the Equality of Curved Lines with the Straight are discussed: They are supported by very strong demonstrations: and from there golden corollaries of Geometric subtleties are deduced: Some Euclidean Elements are corrected, some are rejected as false.

Originally published in Spanish, now rendered into Latin
by
NICOLAS JANSON
Arnh. Geldro.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC:
In quibus subtiliores Geometricae quaestiones de
Duplicatione Cubi, Quadratura circuli, Rectitudine angulorum, Aequalitate linearum curvarum cum recta discutientur: Demonstrationibus firmissimis fulciuntur: indeque aurea corollaria Geometricarum subtilitatum deducuntur
TITLE: EUCLID DESCRIPTION: Elementa nonnulla corriguntur, nonnulla ut falsa reijciuntur

title:
COLLECTION,

OU

RECVEIL DE DIVERS

TRAICTEZ MATHEMATIQVES.

A s√ßauoir ;

D'ARITHMETIQVE, D'ALGEBRE, DE LA

solution de diuers Problemes & questions, tant

Geometriques, qu'Astronomiques.

Conne aussi de plusieurs moyens pour mesurer toutes sortes de

quantitez, soient lignes, superficies & corps.

Item, de la Sphere du monde, auec l'usage & pratique, tant de l'A-

strotable, du Quarr√© Geometrique, & des Globes, que du

Compas de proportion : Et encore de la construction

des fortifications pratiqu√©es aux pays bas.

Par D. Henrion, Professeur √®s Mathematiques.
title_EN:
COLLECTION,

OR

COMPILATION OF VARIOUS

MATHEMATICAL TREATISES.

Namely;

OF ARITHMETIC, ALGEBRA, THE

solution of various Problems & questions, both

Geometric and Astronomical.

Also of several methods to measure all kinds of

quantities, be they lines, surfaces & bodies.

Item, of the Sphere of the world, with the use & practice, both of the As-

trolabe, the Geometric Square, & the Globes, as well as the

Proportional Compass: And also of the construction

of fortifications practiced in the Low Countries.

By D. Henrion, Professor of Mathematics.

title_EN:
EUCLID'S DATA. AND MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER'S COMMENTARY ON EUCLID'S DATA. EUCLID'S
DATA. A WORK ESSENTIAL NOT ONLY FOR THE READING OF THE ANCIENT GEOMETRY AUTHORS ARCHIMEDES, APOLLONIUS, PAPPUS, EUTOCIUS, AND OTHERS, BUT ALSO FOR THE RESTORATION OF GEOMETRIC ANALYSIS, LONG DESIRED BY MANY. CLAUDIUS HARDY, SON OF SEBASTIAN, ADVOCATE IN THE SUPREME PARISIAN COURT, HAS NOW FOR THE FIRST TIME PUBLISHED IT IN GREEK FROM THE LIBRARY OF THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING, TRANSLATED IT INTO LATIN, AND ILLUSTRATED IT WITH NOTES. APPENDED IS THE COMMENTARY OF MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER FROM THE SAME LIBRARY IN GREEK AND LATIN, IN WHICH THE NATURE OF THE GIVEN AND THE USES OF EUCLID'S DATA ARE EXPLAINED.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ‚Äôtmaken, veranderen, t‚Äôsamen-voeghen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen. Overgheset, verclaert, ende uytgheleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe liefhebbers der selver vryer Conste. Door IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer. Van nieus over-sien, ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de byghevoechde nutticheden, mette specien in Geometrische figueren breeder verclaert ende vermeerdert deur den selven Autheur.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated, for the advancement and practice, of all eager lovers of the same liberal Art. By JAN PIETERSZOON DOV, Land Surveyor and Wine Gauger of the city of Leiden. Newly revised, and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded by the same Author.

GEOMETRY,

practice, by two excellent instruments,

one of which is the

wish to be relieved from the long & tedious description

of Geometric figures.

title_EN:
MEMOIRS
MATHEMATICAL,
COLLECTED AND COMPOSED
IN FAVOR OF THE FRENCH
NOBILITY,
By D. HENRION, Mathematician.
FIRST VOLUME,
In which is discussed
Military Arithmetic; Construction of the tables of Sines,
Chords & Tangents; Doctrine of Right-angled Triangles; Practice
of various Geometric problems; Measurement of straight lines,
surfaces & Solids; Practice of the Proportional Compass; & the
Construction of Fortresses, serving as application & augmentation in
the second & third Books of Fortifications by Monsieur Errard.

SECOND EDITION, revised, corrected & augmented in various
places; and even with an entire treatise, containing a brief instruction
for constructing the fortifications used in the Low Countries.

title:
ARITHMETIQVE

MEMORIALE.

Par le moyen de laquelle on peut resolu-
dre en son esprit toutes reigles qui con-
cernent le negoce & trafic de toutes
sortes de marchandifes, fans vfer d‚Äôau-
cuns chiffres ny Gettons.

En suite de laquelle e≈øt vne fucincte dio≈øpofition de
la brie≈øue Arithmetique auec les gettrons, qui e≈øt
grandement nece≈ø≈øaire √§ toutes ≈øortes de per≈øonnes,
pour re≈øoudre toutes reigles, auec plus de facilit√©
&  grande brieuet√© , que par les formes ordina-
res de l‚ÄôArithmetique auec la plume.

Le tout proui≈øant de l‚Äôinuenti√µ du Sieur de la Fon-
taine , l‚Äôvn des Gardes de Mon≈øeigneur le Duc de
Longueuille , Gouuerneur & Lieutenant general

title_EN:
ARITHMETIC

MEMORIAL.

By means of which one can solve
in one's mind all rules concerning
the business & trade of all
kinds of merchandise, without using any
figures or Counters.

Following which is a succinct arrangement of
the brief Arithmetic with counters, which is
greatly necessary for all sorts of people,
to solve all rules, with more ease
& greater brevity, than by the ordinary forms
of Arithmetic with the pen.

All provided by the invention of Sieur de la Fon-
taine, one of the Guards of Monseigneur the Duke of
Longueville, Governor & Lieutenant General
for the King in the province of Normandy.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC:
MEMORIALE.

Par le moyen de laquelle on peut resolu-

title:

MEMORIALLE.

Par le moyen de laquelle on peut resou-
dre en son esprit toutes reigles qui con-
cernent le negoce & trafic de toutes
sortes de marchandises, sans user d'au-
cuns chiffres ny gettons.

En suite de laquelle est une succincte disposition de
la bresve Arithmetique avec les gettrons, qui est
grandement necessaire √† toutes sortes de personnes,
pour resoudre toutes reigles, avec plus de facilit√©
& grande briefvet√©, que par les formes ordina-
res de l'Arithmetique avec la plume.

Le tout prouenant de l'invention du Sieur de la Fon-
taine, l'un des Gardes de Monseigneur le Duc de
Longueville , Gouverneur & Lieutenant general
pour le Roy en la prouince de Normandie.
title_EN:
MEMORIAL
ARITHMETIC.

By means of which one can solve
in one's mind all rules concerning
the business & trade of all
kinds of merchandise, without using any
figures or counters.

Following which is a succinct arrangement of
brief Arithmetic with counters, which is
greatly necessary for all kinds of people,
to solve all rules, with more ease
& great brevity, than by the ordinary
forms of Arithmetic with the pen.

All stemming from the invention of Sieur de la Fon-
taine, one of the Guards of Monseigneur the Duke of
Longueville, Governor & Lieutenant General
for the King in the province of Normandy.

title:
De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fonda-menten der Geometrie. Waer bygevoeght zijn eenige nuttigheden, uyt de selve Boecken getrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ‚Äôtmaken, veranderen, t‚Äôsamenvoegen, aftrecken, ver-menigvuldigen ende deelen. Overgeset, verklaert, ende uytgeleyt, tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leergierige liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste. DOOR JAN PIETERSE DOU: der stadt Leyden Lant-meter ende Wijnroyer. Van nieus oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders
de bygevoegde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying and dividing. Translated, explained, and interpreted, for the advancement and practice of all curious lovers of the same free Art. BY JAN PIETERSE DOU: Land surveyor and Wine gauger of the city of Leyden. Newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and increased, by the same Author.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fonda-menten der Geometrie. Waer by-gevoeght zijn eenige nuttigheden, uyt de selve Boecken getrocken: Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ‚Äôt maken, veranderen, t‚Äôsamen-voegen, af-trecken, ver-menighvuldigen, ende deelen. Over-geset, verklaert, ende uyt-geleydt tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leer-gierige Liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste.  DOOR JAN PIETERSZ DOU, Landt-meter ende Wijn-roeyer der Stadt LEYDEN. Newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.

title_EN:
THE COURSE
OF
MATHEMATICS,

CONTAINING IN ONE HUNDRED FIGURES
a general idea of all parts of this Science,
the use of its instruments, various ways to measure distances,
the Art of surveying, different methods to raise & draw a Plan,
the reduction of Figures by the Triangles of proportion,
Trigonometry, regular & irregular Fortifications,
their exteriors, profile, elevation, & Sciagraphy.

Containing moreover a Treatise on the use of the terrestrial Globe;
& another on Dioptric & Catoptric Optics.

DEDICATED TO THE NOBILITY,
By R. P. Bourdin, of the Society of Jesus.

THIRD EDITION.

title:
EVCLIDES ADAVCTVS
ET METHODICVS
MATHEMATICAE UNIVERSALIS
CAROLO EMANVELI II.
SABAVDIAE DVCI PEDEMONTIVM PRINCIPI
REGI CYPRI, &c.
DICATA,

Quae ne dum propositionum dependentiam, sed & rerum ordinem observat. Et complectitur ea omnia, quae de quantitate tum discreta, tum continua abstracta speculari queunt. Rescissis superfluis demonstrationibus, & requisitis omnibus profus√® coadunatis.

Singuli quoque Tractatus novis propositionibus aucti sunt, & aliqui etiam ex integro adornati. Omnesque tum figuris, tum verbis clare, dulciloqu√®que propositi.

AUCTORE
D. GVARINO GVARINO
MVTINENSI C. R. TH√âATINO,
Philosofo, Theologo & eiusdem R. C. Mathematico.
title_EN:
EVCLID ADVANCED
AND METHODICAL
UNIVERSAL MATHEMATICS
DEDICATED TO
CARLO EMANUEL II,
DUKE OF SAVOY, PRINCE OF PIEDMONT,
KING OF CYPRUS, &c.

Which not only observes the dependency of propositions, but also the order of things. And encompasses all that can be speculated about quantity, both discrete and continuous, in the abstract. With superfluous demonstrations removed, and all necessary requisites profusely united.

Each Treatise has also been enriched with new propositions, and some even entirely newly adorned. All are clearly and sweetly proposed, both in figures and in words.

BY THE AUTHOR
D. GUARINO GUARINI
OF MODENA, C. R. THEATINE,
Philosopher, Theologian & Mathematician of the same R. C.

Bestaende in twee Deelen:

Het eerste Deel: Handeldt van de Meetkonstige
Werckstucken, begrepen in de ses eerste Boecken Euclidis:

Het tweede Deel: Geeft aanleyding om verscheyde
Werckstucken te maecken, als van Snijding, Raecking, Deeling,
Perspectie en Sonnewijssers:

Alleenigh met een Passer te wercken (sonder Rye ofte Liniael te
gebruycken) door Snijding van Roeden.

Voorgesteld
Door
GEORG MOHR.
title_EN:
EUCLIDES DANICUS,
Consisting in two Parts:

The first Part: Deals with the Geometrical
Works, contained in the first six Books of Euclid:

The second Part: Provides guidance to create various
Works, such as Cutting, Touching, Dividing,
Perspective, and Sundials:

Working solely with a Compass (without using a Ruler or Straightedge)
through the Cutting of Rods.

Presented
By
GEORG MOHR.

title:
P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI E SOCIET. JESU
Olim in Panormitano Sicili√¶, nunc in Herbipolitano Franconi√¶ ejusdem SOCIETATIS JESU Gymnasio Matheseos Professoris CURSUS MATHEMATICUS, SIVE ABSOLUTA OMNIUM MATHEMATICARUM DISCIPLINARUM ENCYCLOP√ÜDIA, In
Libros XXVIII. digesta, eoque ordine disposita, ut quivis, vel mediocri pr√¶ditus ingenio, totam Mathesin √† primis fundamentis proprio Marte addiscere possit. Opus desideratum diu, promissum √† multis, √† non paucis tentatum, √† nullo numeris omnibus absolutum. Accesserunt in fine THEORESES MECHANIC√Ü NOV√Ü Additis Indicibus locupletissimis.
title_EN:
P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI OF THE SOCIETY OF JESUS
Formerly in the Panormitan of Sicily, now in the Herbipolitan of Franconia of the same SOCIETY OF JESUS, Professor of Mathematics in the Gymnasium MATHEMATICAL COURSE, OR COMPLETE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF ALL MATHEMATICAL DISCIPLINES, Arranged in 28 Books, and disposed in such order that anyone, even with mediocre talent, can learn the whole of Mathematics from the very foundations by their own effort. A work long desired, promised by many, attempted by not a few, completed by none in all respects. At the end, NEW MECHANICAL THEOREMS have been added, along with very comprehensive indexes.

title_EN:

OF JESUS. Formerly in the Panormitan of Sicily, now in the Herbipolitan of Franconia of the same SOCIETY OF JESUS, Professor of Mathematics in the Gymnasium. MATHEMATICAL COURSE, Or COMPLETE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF ALL MATHEMATICAL DISCIPLINES,

title: De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Desen laetsten druck, van nieuws oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de by-gevoegde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.

This latest edition, newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.

ALL THE SCIENCES
That have magnitudes as their object.

FIRST VOLUME

title: De zes eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fon-damenten der Geometrie.
